Broker.title: Broker is a simplified representation of a Knative Eventing Broker that is easier to consume by the Backstage plugin.

annotations.description: Annotations of the broker. These are passed as is, except that are filtered out by the FilterAnnotations function.

labels.description: Labels of the broker. These are passed as is.

providedEventTypes.description:
ProvidedEventTypes is a list of event types that the broker provides.
This is a list of strings, where each string is a "<namespace>/<name>" of the event type.

EventMesh.description: It's the struct that's serialized and sent to the Backstage plugin.
EventMesh.title: EventMesh is the top-level struct that holds the event mesh data.

brokers.description: Brokers is a list of all brokers in the cluster.

eventTypes.description:
EventTypes is a list of all event types in the cluster.
While we can embed the event types in the brokers, we keep them separate because
not every event type is tied to a broker.

EventType.title: EventType is a simplified representation of a Knative Eventing EventType that is easier to consume by the Backstage plugin.

annotations.description: Annotations of the event type. These are passed as is, except that are filtered out by the FilterAnnotations function.

consumedBy.description: ConsumedBy is a <namespace/name> list of the consumers of the event type.

labels.description: Labels of the event type. These are passed as is.

reference.description: Reference is the ET's reference to a resource like a broker or a channel. It is in the format "<namespace>/<name>".
